content.description:
Note: Figure not drawn to scale.

The figure above shows a spotlight shining on point P(x,y) on the shoreline of Crescent Island. The spotlight is located at the origin and is rotating. The portion of the shoreline on which the spotlight shines is in the shape of the parabola y = x2 from the point (1,1) to the point (5,25) . Let θ be the angle between the beam of light and the positive x-axis.
content.question: For what values of θ between 0 and 2π does the spotlight shine on the shoreline?

frqParts.text: For what values of θ between 0 and 2π does the spotlight shine on the shoreline?

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.4: (BC ONLY) Defining and Differentiating Vector-Valued Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
